entry.title: Add ContentAutofillRouter method to split browser forms & predictions.
entry.content:
Autofill's notion of what a form is differs with that of password

manager: Password manager operates in terms of renderer forms, whereas

Autofill may merge multiple (potentially frame-transcending) renderer

forms into a single browser form.



This CL adds functionality to undo this merge.

entry.title: FieldTrials: Don't crash in child if parent process was killed.
entry.content:
Implementing this logic only on POSIX for now, since we've observed

this mainly on Mac.



The following CL changed a DCHECK to a CHECK and we started seeing

crash reports about this:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4679330



Thanks to a local repro, I can confirm this CHECK would get hit

if the browser process crashes while child processes are being

launched. What happens is the shared memory handle becomes

invalid and mapping it fails in the child.



Since we would otherwise hit a CHECK(), this CL adds a codepath

to check for whether the parent process is dead and if so, to

exit gracefully instead of crashing with a crash report.



Verified locally by making the browser process crash by adding

a CHECK in VariationsService::PerformPreMainMessageLoopStartup().



Bug: 1469629

Change-Id: If5fcb6da23698bf366abc625f3b2293a396b527c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4752775

Reviewed-by: Luc Nguyen

Commit-Queue: Alexei Svitkine

entry.title: [EditContext] Stop adjusting selection in a couple of places
entry.content:
When testing on Android I found a few scenarios that were broken

because we are adjusting selection when we shouldn't be.



SetCompositionFromExistingText is called (on Android) when the user

places focus in an EditContext when there is already text present.

It sets composition to surround the last word before the selection.

Erroneously, it is also adjusting the selection to be before this new

composition range. Thus, the caret is in the wrong spot if the

user starts typing.



In this CL, make SetCompositionFromExistingText no longer adjust

the selection, thus matching

InputMethodController::SetCompositionFromExistingText which also

does not adjust selection.



Similarly, EditContext::SetCompositionFromExistingText should not

modify the EditContext's text_; only the composition range should

be adjusted.



Secondly, update EditContext::FinishComposingText to respect the

ConfirmCompositionBehavior param and not adjust the selection in

the kDoNotKeepSelection case. This comes up, for example, when

the user terminates composition by moving the caret to another

place in the EditContext -- in this case FinishCompostingText

should not move the selection again.



Bug: 999184, 1468567

Change-Id: I8e20eec9da3cf887e0024bfc5992681bd49ae7de

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4727942

Reviewed-by: Anupam Snigdha

Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

Commit-Queue: Dan Clark

entry.title: [color] Avoid libmonet using pink when pure black is selected
entry.content:
This CL avoids an edge case with the libmonet library where a

pink primary color is chosen when a black user color is selected.

This can result in confusing UX where all other shades of gray

result in the choice of a blue primary color.



This CL does this by setting the user color one step above black

if a pure black user color is detected.

entry.title: [wptrunner] Run wdspec tests with wptrunner (1/2)
entry.content:
This change drop-in replaces the bespoke webdriver WPT harness,

`run_webdriver_tests.py`, with WPT's wptrunner, which is approaching

general availability in Chromium. Using the official harness confers

many advantages:

* Substantial speedup due to native harness parallelism (~110 -> 25 min

in total shard runtime for debug, ~35 -> 10 for release).

* ResultDB integration via ResultSink, including streaming.

* More resilient to different failure modes (e.g., crashes in

crbug.com/1457101).

* Less duplicate code to maintain.

* The WPT importer will eventually autosuppress all new WPTs using

`.ini` expectations [0] only.



The `.ini` expectations added here were generated mechanically with

`blink_tool.py update-metadata`. A spot check suggests they faithfully

match `WebDriverExpectations`.



A follow-up CL will clean up obsolete webdriver-specific logic in

`blinkpy`.



[0]: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/testing/web_platform_tests_wptrunner.md#Expectations



Bug: 1414565

Change-Id: I4ccf0e7dff767b2770e7e41a435d3408ff4bf180

entry.title: [Android] Rename confusing waitForView() overload which does not wait
entry.content:
waitForView() is renamed to withEventualExpectedViewState().



Also add waitForViewCheckingState() and waitForVisibleView() which

wait as callers expect. Migrate correct usages of

withEventualExpectedViewState() to these methods in most cases.



This is a no-op but it makes evident the callers that use the

confusing API correctly:



The statements now starting with ViewUtils.waitForVisibleView() and

ViewUtils.waitForViewCheckingState() function as expected.



The statements starting with

ViewUtils.withEventualExpectedViewState() and

ViewUtils.isEventuallyVisible() sound wrong and are incorrect usages.

These methods are meant to be used inside ViewMatchers.

I will fix these usages in subsequent CLs, since that's more than a

no-op refactor. Added TODOs meanwhile to flag the incorrect usages.

entry.title: [Uno] Migrate TailoredSecurityService away from ConsentLevel::kSync
entry.content:
The tailored security service is either configured from synced

preferences, or polled from another server.



This CL makes the check more accurate, as this was previously

checking the state of the overall sync feature. This could be a

problem for users who have Sync enabled, but preferences not synced,

as they would previously not get the right value for the

TailoredSecurityService.



This also makes the code compatible with the Sync deprecation. It

won't be possible to enable sync, but will still be possible to

enable individual datatypes. With this CL the TailoredSecurityService

will keep working through this deprecation.



Bug: 1462286

entry.title: [iOS] Have TabEventsMediator implement NTPTabHelperDelegate
entry.content:
Moves the NewTabPageTabHelperDelegate implementation from the

BrowserCoordinator to the TabEventsMediator. This delegate function is

used to handle NTP visibility changes within a web state, and the

TabEventsMediator is already responsible for handling all other NTP

visibility changes. This centralizes all NTP visibility toggles within

one class and slims down the responsibility of the BrowserCoordinator.

entry.title: [ReadingList] Delete sync-ed entries if recently restored from backup
entry.content:
Analogous to https://crrev.com/c/4727928 , ported here for reading

lists.



The new logic is guarded behind feature flags (one of which is a

dedicated kill switch for reading list).



The design follows the very same principles (see description of the

patch linked above), but the implementation is slightly different

because, as opposed to bookmarks, reading list is implemented as

ModelTypeSyncBridge.



Specifically, ModelTypeSyncBridge::ApplyDisableSyncChanges() is

guaranteed to be invoked in all relevant cases. However, determining

whether the new behavior should be triggered requires careful guarding

during ModelReadyToSync().

entry.title: Stop using FormStructure in PWM::ProcessAutofillPredictions.
entry.content:
This CL replaces autofill::FormStructure by autofill::FormData

and server prediction data in. This is part of a larger effort to

transition PWM away from using FormStructure which is motivated as

follows:

- FormStructure currently serves multiple purposes. It contains

sectioning information, server prediction data, voting information

for upload in AutofillDownloadManager, etc. We would like to move

some of that into its own separate structures instead of bloating

FormStructure further.

- FormStructures are supposed to be managed by AutofillManager

in a central cache and referenced by ids. In particular, consumers

are not supposed to just create their own FormStructures or break

existing ones apart (see also go/autofill-form-management-redesign).

However, to properly translate information from Autofill to

PasswordManager, we need to split apart the FormStructure

associated with a single browser form into multiple objects that each

correspond to a renderer form with predictions (to match PWM's notion

of what a "form" is). This splitting can instead happen on a FormData

and predictions level.



Apart from some changes to the logging code (used only in internals

pages), this CL makes no functional changes - it simply replaces

FormStructure information by analogous FormData & AutofillPrediction

information.



Bug: 1466435

Change-Id: I9270460a6165ad0cb31f125e2096919f72c86fff

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4729401

Reviewed-by: Vasilii Sukhanov

entry.title: Support lookback window
entry.content:
Support lookback window by adding an optional reserved keyword

`lookback_window` to trigger's filters.



spec: https://github.com/WICG/attribution-reporting-api/pull/914



When set, the field is parsed as a duration in seconds.



To decide if a filter matches, we first check the lookback window. If available, the duration since the source was registered must be smaller or equal to the lookback window duration.



Backward compatibility: by introducing a new reserved keyword, the spec

breaks source registrations which are currently using the `lookback_window` key. To ease migration, we don't yet prevent sources

from using the `lookback_window` key and we process a trigger's

`lookback_window` key as other filter keys when its associated value is

a list of strings.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Conversions.SourceRegistrationError3]=Replaced with

Conversions.SourceRegistrationError4 due to addition of new enum value.



Change-Id: Ie87e9613493fa3b00e04567d712f7ef64e193e89

entry.title: XMLHttpRequest::response_text_ can be a StringBuilder
entry.content:
Currently, response_text_ is the sole user of TraceWrapperV8String.

It's not obvious that this is providing any perf or memory benefits

over using a StringBuilder.



In https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/b3fe60d6db06aaf183ace37ac8464d78af123de7,

I incorrectly used TraceWrapperV8String and introduced a perf

regression due to unnecessary v8::String->blink::String->v8::String

conversions. This fixes that regression, as well as simplifying

XMLHttpRequest.



Bug: 1463835

entry.title: [views] Prevent Widget::native_theme_ set for testing from being reset
entry.content:
Currently many tests are using Widget::SetNativeThemeForTest() to set

a test theme instance. However theme updates can trigger logic that

resets the native theme instance, meaning the test instance will

no longer apply.



This CL adds a flag to ensure the test instance is not clobbered

during theme updates.

entry.title: [accessibility] Fix AnimatorDurationScaleDelegate registration and use
entry.content:
ui::AccessibilityState::GetDelegates() was returning a copy of the list

of delegates, so RegisterAnimatorDurationScaleDelegate had no

effect. This means that NotifyAnimatorDurationScaleObservers and

NotifyRecordAccessibilityServiceInfoHistogram never issued any

notifications, and UnregisterAnimatorDurationScaleDelegate, had it ever

been called, would have led to a crash.



Bug: 1362100

entry.title: [ios] Remove WebStateActivatedAt() from FullscreenWebStateListObserver
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 82789440feaede7a752d2f0dd6c3602e15105fb4

with a fix.



The original CL was reverted because InactiveTabsTestCase tests failed.

There were 2 failing points:

1. MoveContentBelowHeader() in fullscreen_content_adjustment_util.mm

because inactive tabs are not the "realized" state yet and they

don't have the CRWWebViewProxy object when WebStates move from

an inactive browser to an active browser.

2. Call removeObserver: to a non-registered object in

fullscreen_web_view_resizer.mm.



The first issue was fixed by

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4737971 by

forcefully realizing the active WebState just after active_index_ is

updated.



This CL has a workaround for the second issue by adding

`_installedObserver` flag in FullscreenWebViewResizer.



Original change's description:

> [ios] Remove WebStateActivatedAt() from FullscreenWebStateListObserver

>

> This CL updates FullscreenWebStateListObserver to handle the activation of WebState in WebStateListDidChange().

>

> Bug: 1442546

> Change-Id: Idd70ccf6f4b40a22296ce0c4e918ca3b67a6c103

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4705344

> Commit-Queue: Asami Doi

> Reviewed-by: Sylvain Defresne

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1177810}



Bug: 1442546

Change-Id: I4de7a7ebd0c4a7c4d70a8e5c0154f87bc103c880

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4742381

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Sylvain Defresne

entry.title: [ios][RBS] Fix FollowTabHelper failing DCHECK
entry.content:
Content of IsWebChannelsEnabled() can change at runtime, this after

change https://crrev.com/c/4711116.

For this reason DCHECK(_followIPHPresenter) started failing and

previous fix was not enough (https://crrev.com/c/4732997).



In this CL FollowTabHelper is always initialised (see

tab_helper_util.mm). As a consequence, IsWebChannelsEnabled checks

were added inside follow_tab_helper.mm.



A similar solution was adopted for PriceNotificationsTabHelper,

see: https://crrev.com/c/4447579.



Bug: 1468339

Change-Id: I74e039f84c6100665d0b10c4121e95eee844f091

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4732832

entry.title: Fix a few more tests that fail with Rust JSON parser
entry.content:
AggregationServiceNetworkFetcherTest



This test makes requests the responses to which must be parsed. With

the new Rust JSON parser, that parsing occurs in a thread-pool, so

the test must run the loop until that parsing is complete.



SearchResultLoaderTest, SearchResponseParserTest,

TranslationResponseParserTest, TranslationResultLoaderTest



Handling JSON now requires a thread pool, when using the Rust

parser. The `SingleThreadTaskEnvironment` does not supply this,

but a full `TaskEnvironment` does.





DevicePolicyDecoderTest



The precise form of that error differs depending on which JSON

parser is in use. But this test is really only checking that the

JSON error is reported, so this CL modifies the assertion to match.



Bug: 1455145

Change-Id: Ie0890db7f985239fb4ce665795f6a280483a3e54

entry.title: [Android][3PPWM] Options controller persists pref and records metrics
entry.content:
This CL adds the model and the mediator for the autofill options

component. It initializes subcomponents after the fragment is created.



The model contains UI state and view callbacks.

The mediator persists the pref on change and records each unique change.

When the fragment is resumed, the mediator will update the model to

reflect the latest state of the pref.



The UI is unchanged and strings are far from being finalized.

entry.content:
TestPaymentsClient kept a pointer to an argument passed by const

reference that is not required (or expected) to outlive the call.

The actual PaymentsClient implementation creates a copy of the

UnmaskRequest, but the test client's handling leads to a dangling

pointer.



This CL fixes that.

entry.title: bindings: Use the exact type for sync iterator types
entry.content:
Synchronous iterator type for interface type X is actually implemented

as SyncIterator (a subclass of ScriptWrappable), but SyncIteratorType

(typedef to `object`) has been used to represent synchronous iterator

types as return type just because it works as a placeholder.



The trick was that the bindings generator uses `auto&&` for return type

and does not need to know the exact return type (unless there are overloads).

```

auto&& return_value = blink_receiver->foo(...);

bindings::V8SetReturnValue(info, return_value, ...);

```

However, when there are overloads (including optional arguments), the

bindings generator needs to know the exact return type.

```

ReturnType return_value; // Needs to declare `return_value` with the exact type.

do {

if (no args) {

return_value = blink_receiver->foo();

break;

}

if (arg[0] is type X) {

auto&& arg1_x = NativeValueTraits::ArgumentValue(...);

return_value = blink_receiver->foo(arg1_x);

break;

}

...

} while (false);

bindings::V8SetReturnValue(info, return_value, ...);

```



When we will implement Web IDL async iterable, which supports optional

arguments, the bindings generator needs to know the exact return type.

So, this patch makes the bindings generator use the exact type instead

of `SyncIteratorType` (just a placeholder).



Bug: 1087157

Change-Id: I2f6f68d0cd52d7c673395ed58f76fcd52e0467df

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4743319

Commit-Queue: Yuki Shiino

entry.title: [Desktop][I18n] Remove address references from AddressComponentUi.
entry.content:
I18n requires supporting all ServerFieldType values. These field

values should be stored in a generic

mapping. However, this task can't be achieved directly cause Web

IDL doesn't support mappings. AutofillProfile fields will be passed

in the array [(ServerFieldType, string)] to the UI code.



This makes committing the value of 1 field O(# of fields) task.

Thus, we switch to committing changes only when user clicks the

"Save" editor button.



This CL is an intermediate step towards supporting all ServerFieldType

fields. It effectively makes address_edit_dialog write all changes to

a local map and commit them only upon user clicking the "Save" button.

entry.title: [BRP] Add raw_ptr<T>::AsEphemeralRawAddr()
entry.content:
- Add `raw_ptr.AsEphemeralRawAddr()` to provide *extremely*

short-lived `T**` or `T*&`.

- Users must NOT store `T**` or `T*&` anywhere, even as a local

variable.

- Users must NOT use `raw_ptr`, `T**` or `T*&` multiple times within

an expression.



```

void GetSomeClassPtr(SomeClass** out_arg) {

*out_arg = ...;

}

void FillPtr(SomeClass*& out_arg) {

out_arg = ...;

}

void Foo() {

raw_ptr ptr;

GetSomeClassPtr(&ptr.AsEphemeralRawAddr());

FillPtr(ptr.AsEphemeralRawAddr()); // Implicitly converted into |SomeClass*&|.

}

```



See `//base/memory/raw_ptr.md` for more details.



Bug: 1469511

Change-Id: Ief2648b1e2193a73ece16de70171a5643b4811bf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4742180

Reviewed-by: Keishi Hattori

Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1179505}
